text: Antti Lieroinen (died 1643), was a famous Finnish cunning man. He was sentenced to death for witchcraft in Åbo and executed accused of witchcraft, murder of a man and adultery after having seduced a married woman.Biografiakeskus, Suomalaisen Kirjallisuuden Seura (Finland National Biography of Finland) He was famous in contemporary Finland for his alleged ability to find stolen objects, and famed as a professional wizard (cunning man) long before his trial.Biografiakeskus, Suomalaisen Kirjallisuuden Seura (Finland National Biography of Finland) He belongs to the more well known of the victims of the Finnish witch trials.Biografiakeskus, Suomalaisen Kirjallisuuden Seura (Finland National Biography of Finland) He is the subject of a play, a poem and an opera.Biografiakeskus, Suomalaisen Kirjallisuuden Seura (Finland National Biography of Finland) ==References== Category:1643 deaths Category:People executed for witchcraft Category:17th-century Finnish people Category:Cunning folk Category:17th-century executions
title: Antti Lieroinen
